snippet: After a close vote at the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.) convention, the wording that a union is between “a man and a woman” was retained.
abstract: Presbyterian Church (USA) votes at its annual convention against changing the definition of marriage in its constitution from a union between a man and a woman to a union between two people; the issue has long divided mainline Protestant churches.
lead_paragraph: After a close vote at the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.) convention, the wording that a union is between “a man and a woman” was retained.

headline.seo: Presbyterians Reject Change in Definition of Marriage
headline.main: Presbyterians Vote to Keep Definition of Marriage
headline.print_headline: Presbyterians Vote to Keep Definition Of Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
